What is the purpose of the `sendfrom` command in Verus?

The `sendfrom` command in Verus is used to send an amount of VRSC from a specified account to a VRSC address. Note that this command is deprecated and it is recommended to use `sendtoaddress` instead.

sendfrom "fromaccount" "toVRSCaddress" amount ( minconf "comment" "comment-to" ) DEPRECATED (use sendtoaddress). Sent an amount from an account to a VRSC address. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001. Arguments: 1. "fromaccount"    (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error. 2. "toVRSCaddress" (string, required) The VRSC address to send funds to. 3. amount        (numeric, required) The amount in VRSC (transaction fee is added on top). 4. minconf        (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use funds with at least this many confirmations. 5. "comment"      (string, optional) A comment used to store what the transaction is for.                    This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet. 6. "comment-to"    (string, optional) An optional comment to store the name of the person or organization                    to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction,                    it is just kept in your wallet. Result: "transactionid"    (string) The transaction id. Examples: Send 0.01 VRSC from the default account to the address, must have at least 1 confirmation > verus sendfrom "" "RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV" 0.01 Send 0.01 from the tabby account to the given address, funds must have at least 6 confirmations > verus sendfrom "tabby" "RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV" 0.01 6 "donation" "seans outpost" As a json rpc call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "sendfrom", "params": ["tabby", "RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV", 0.01, 6, "donation", "seans outpost"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What are the required arguments for the `sendfrom` command?

The required arguments for the `sendfrom` command are:

1. "fromaccount" (string, required) - MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account.
2. "toVRSCaddress" (string, required) - The VRSC address to send funds to.
3. amount (numeric, required) - The amount in VRSC (transaction fee is added on top).

sendfrom "fromaccount" "toVRSCaddress" amount ( minconf "comment" "comment-to" ) DEPRECATED (use sendtoaddress). Sent an amount from an account to a VRSC address. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001. Arguments: 1. "fromaccount"    (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. "comment"      (string, optional) A comment used to store what the transaction is for.                    This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet. 6. "comment-to"    (string, optional) An optional comment to store the name of the person or organization                    to which you're sending the transaction. What is the optional "minconf" argument used for in the `sendfrom` command?
The optional "minconf" argument is used to specify the minimum number of confirmations required for the funds to be used in the transaction. It defaults to 1 if not specified.

sendfrom "fromaccount" "toVRSCaddress" amount ( minconf "comment" "comment-to" ) DEPRECATED (use sendtoaddress). Sent an amount from an account to a VRSC address. What are the optional "comment" and "comment-to" arguments used for in the `sendfrom` command?

The optional "comment" and "comment-to" arguments are used to store additional information about the transaction in your wallet. "comment" is a general comment about the transaction, and "comment-to" is an optional comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. These comments are not part of the transaction itself, but are stored in your wallet for your reference.
